chart1.title: Distribution of projects by intervention sector

chart2.title: Distribution of projects by type of beneficiaries
chart2.refugeesDescription: Refugees are people fleeing conflict or persecution. Their status is defined and protected by international law and refugees cannot be expelled or returned to situations where their life and freedom are at risk.
chart2.displacedDescription: Internally displaced persons have not crossed any international border to find safety. Unlike refugees, they have fled within their own country.
chart2.returneesDescription: Returnees: This group includes people who are considered not to need international protection or who have no compelling humanitarian reasons to remain in the host country ("rejected asylum seekers"), as well as those who have never applied for asylum. People who have withdrawn their asylum application and wish to return to their country of origin also fall into this category.
chart2.localCommunitiesDescription: Indigenous populations: Generally speaking, indigenous populations are descendants of peoples who inhabited a given region when it was conquered or colonized, or when existing national borders were defined by current dominant cultures.

disabledCount.percentage: That is {count}% of the total beneficiary population
